programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: People bring prized possessions for evaluation and pricing.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Items presented include a roll of Beatles wallpaper, the passport belonging to the world's smallest man, and carved whale teeth.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The roadshow team is in St. Ives, an historic market town in Cambridgeshire; finds include an early pocket calculator, a googly eyed doll, a Clarice Cliff coffee set, some Crimean medals, and a pilot's logbook.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: At the Royal Navy Hospital in Gosport, finds include a satinwood secretaire, a radiograph of Edward VIII's hand, and an Edward Lear sketch.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Trencherfield Mill in Wigan, Lancashire.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The annual London to Brighton Veteran Car Run begins in Hyde Park; motoring memorabilia.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.sub-title: The Royal Horticultural Societ Gardens at Wisley
programme.desc: Caravan.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.sub-title: The Royal Horticultural Society Gardens at Wisley
programme.desc: Letters written by Lewis Carroll; a carriage clock saved from a skip.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Mosaics made by prisoners of war are on display in Portmeirion, North Wales; contender for Champion Collector of the U.K.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Hadrian's Wall; original fittings from Titanic's sister ship, the Olympic; Roman coin; letter from J.R.R. Tolkien.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team head for Hastings where they uncover a Meissan pot, a doodle by artist Augustus John and a wedding gift from the 1920's that has never been opened.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Puppet theater cast; Worcester plate; drawing by L.S. Lowry; Staffordshire slipware.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A rare clock given as a gift by Queen Victoria; a stash of silver; Beatles memorabilia.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Documents of the Domesday Book and an SOS telegram sent from the Titanic; a picture made of human hair; mahogany coffer.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: At Hampton Court, treasures are a bronze produced by Rodin, an early long case clock, and a sketch by abstract artist Mondrian valued at over $75,000.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The experts head to Hampton Court and discover a rare coral bracelet valued at over $45,000, an unusual doll, a dress by Vivienne Westwood and a pendant shaped like a pig with a link to Mount Everest.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Chastity belt; 1875 sewing machine; Beatles memorabilia; 40 models of Humber cars.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: An 18th-century embroidered court dress; a rare silver beaker; brooch given by the Queen Mother to her head chef in 1937.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow Detectives
programme.desc: Paul Atterbury investigates the mystery that surrounds a portrait of Tina Strobos, a member of the Dutch resistance during the 2nd World War.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: An ornate Russian cigarette case; 19th century tourist's trinket depicting torture.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Two hundred typewriters; suffragette doll dressed in clothes cut from prison uniforms; ring; ornate table.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A painting bought at a bootsale; Prince of Wales tea caddy; clock.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Amongst the items featured at Cardiff Castle are an African witch doctor's ceremonial stick, a schoolboy's exercise book from 1745 and a Scandinavian drinking tankard valued at $18,000.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A letter from Florence Nightingale; racing silk; old wedding photographs; art deco diamond brooch.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A machine gun from World War I; a papal portrait retrieved from a river bottom; rare maps recording the early settlement of America.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Grape holder made of silver; cabinet of rare microscope slides; ruby and diamond brooch.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow visits the Outer Hebrides as Michael and the team head for Stornoway on the island of Lewis; among the items brought to light are some gruesome early medical instruments, a table made from salvaged wood, and a painting.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: An art deco cigarette case; shock therapy machine; an ornate pedestal.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: "Scrimshaw" decorated ostrich eggs; a box made of debris taken from HMS Victory following the Battle of Trafalgar.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team head to Abergavenny in Wales; amongst the items brought to light are an exquisitely carved whalebone and a macabre pottery model of a famous Victorian murder scene; a bizarre coincidence unites two Beatles collectors.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Prehistoric spear heads; an early American flag; silver tankard; pair of spectacles worn by Napoleon.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A set of royal cufflinks; letter from Adm. Nelson; collection of silver found in the back of a church's safe.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A set of royal cufflinks; letter from Adm. Nelson; collection of silver found in the back of a church's safe.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Michael Aspel traces what happened to some of the items featured on the show; preview of a new program.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A small statue thought to be from King Tut's tomb; Punch & Judy set; sword pistol.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Bust of Dylan Thomas.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: An early Mickey Mouse mascot; a rare deco figurine; documents that once belonged to the bodyguard of the Duke and Duchess of Windsor.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Marble bust; pair of rare candlesticks; a man collects and races antique lawnmowers.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Pannier Market in Tavistock, Devon.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Finds from Lichfield and Normanby include a ring once owned by the Romanian royal family, an Arts and Crafts bed, and a collection of coffinalia.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Duke's chamber pot now used to drink champagne; early record player.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: At Beamish Open Air Museum, items include a rare rapier, battlefield finds, and a music box.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A visit to Manderston, near Berwick on Tweed, features pieces from Queen Victoria's household.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Amongst the objects in Rochdale are a gold pencil and paint brushes used by LS Lowry.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team visit the Royal Hospital in Chelsea and discover items like a roulette table built to outwit cheats valued at $45,000 and a collection of buttons worn by Charles Dickens.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Among the objects under scrutiny at the seaside resort of Ventnor on the Isle of Wight are a family portrait showing the future Speaker of the House of Commons as a young boy.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Michael Aspel introduces a selection of unscreened finds from recent Roadshows, including an Edward VIII coronation souvenir that was hastily converted to an abdication mug, and perhaps the earliest fan mail for Elton John.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Pair of clogs; series of letters from the Crimea; intricately woven tapestry.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow Detectives
programme.desc: Andy McConnell helps a daughter to discover the truth about her father's working life at the Whitefriars Glass factory.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Original designs from one of Britain's leading graphic artists; Japanese depiction of skeletons dancing; lost masterpiece.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team head for Coughton Court in Warwickshire, where the experts get excited about an Agatha Christie letter and a rare china figure of the queen on horseback.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Furniture made by convicts; keel of Capt. Cook's ship; items that belonged to Maria Callas.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Letter from Lord Nelson; portraits depicting ancestors of Walt Disney; correspondence from John Lennon's Aunt Mimi.

programme.title: Permanent
programme.desc: Aurelie, 13, dreams about getting a perm so that she can finally fit in at her small-town Virginia school. Things soon go incredibly wrong when her clueless parents bring her to a beauty school to save a few bucks.

programme.title: Humpday
programme.desc: Two longtime buddies (Mark Duplass, Joshua Leonard) decide to sleep together and record the encounter for a homemade sex-film festival.

programme.title: Cashback
programme.desc: Imaginatively freezing time, an art student (Sean Biggerstaff) spends his hours as a grocery-store worker undressing women and sketching their portraits.

programme.title: World's Greatest Dad
programme.desc: A high-school poetry teacher (Robin Williams) is also a single father and dreams of becoming a successful writer, but a freak accident leads to both tragedy and opportunity.

programme.title: What Just Happened?
programme.desc: A movie producer (Robert De Niro) tries to engineer a reconciliation with his ex-wife while dealing with a number of problems surrounding his latest projects.

programme.title: The Brass Teapot
programme.desc: A magical antique transforms a couple (Juno Temple, Michael Angarano) from hapless losers into instant winners. Each time they experience pain, the object fills with money.

programme.title: The Commune
programme.desc: Personal desires clash with solidarity and tolerance in a Danish commune.

programme.title: Drinking Buddies
programme.desc: Although they're both dating other people, two co-workers (Olivia Wilde, Jake Johnson) hang out together in bars and try to ignore their mutual attraction.

programme.title: Barry Munday
programme.desc: A slacker (Patrick Wilson) inherits new responsibilities after he impregnates a stranger (Judy Greer).

programme.title: Results
programme.desc: Personal trainers (Guy Pearce, Cobie Smulders) are charged with whipping a newly wealthy and highly unmotivated slob (Kevin Corrigan) into shape.

programme.title: Prince Avalanche
programme.desc: Two road-crew workers (Paul Rudd, Emile Hirsch) spend the summer of 1988 isolated and away from their city lives, eventually finding themselves at odds with each other and their women back home.

programme.title: A Long Way Down
programme.desc: Four strangers who planned to jump off the same roof on New Year's Eve join together as a kind of family and give themselves six weeks to find valid reasons to live.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Clare has been distracted lately so Eli organizes a surprise birthday party to cheer her up but starts to suspect that she's hiding something. Audra urges Drew to go back to Degrassi. Dave worries that he and Alli are growing apart.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: When a group of parents try to stop the play, Eli takes action. As opening night approaches, Tristan realizes that if he doesn't find a boyfriend fast, his first kiss will be onstage -- with Dave.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: On opening night for Romeo and Jules, Tristan is nowhere to be found. Is it stage fright -- or something worse? While Eli is busy with the play, Clare decides to get even with Asher. And a very unlikely person steps in to save the show.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: As Becky begins to fall for Adam, she worries how her conservative parents will react. Bianca urges Drew to reconnect with his mom. At a loss for film ideas, Eli is desperate for creative inspiration.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Becky doesn't want to keep Adam a secret, so she decides to tell her parents that he's transgender. Bianca seeks Audra's approval to marry Drew. Eli's short film fails to impress a visiting director.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Maya is not feeling very good about herself, so she allows Tori to give her a pageant-style makeover. Marisol suspects Mo of hiding something from her and she fears the worst. Is he in trouble? Meanwhile, Adam tries out for the boys' volleyball team.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Maya's friendship with Tori is tested when both girls compete in the Miss Millennial pageant. Marisol confronts Mo about his strange behavior, and he confirms her fears. Audra catches Adam in a lie.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: I Want It That Way, Pt. 1
programme.desc: Frustrated with her heavy workload, and encouraged to let loose a little, Alli decides to have a little fun -- with or without Dave. Tristan tries to lose weight to impress his crush. Fiona makes a bad impression on Imogen's mom.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: I Want It That Way, Pt. 2
programme.desc: After several days without sleep, Alli crashes at the worst possible time. Tristan's diet has dramatic results -- but not the ones he'd hoped for. Fiona tries to patch things up with Imogen and her mom.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: At the Battle of the Bands, Adam really hits it off with Missy, another musician.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: As WhisperHug prepares for the band competition, things get messy between Adam and Missy. Clare confronts Helen and Glenn about the double standard at home. Chaz Bono guest stars.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Drew can't wait to tie the knot with Bianca in Vegas. But the closer they get, the more he second guesses their decision. When Bianca discovers Drew's wavering, she freaks!

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Drew can't wait to tie the knot with Bianca in Vegas. But the closer they get, the more he second guesses their decision. When Bianca discovers Drew's wavering, she freaks!

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: When tragedy strikes at Degrassi, everyone deals with the situation in a different way. As the students struggle to cope, Simpson cancels Spirit Week.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Haunted by Degrassi's recent tragedy, Eli invites Jake and Mo to a secret party. Meanwhile, Marisol tries to reunite Jake and Katie, and Jenna forms an unexpected bond with Connor.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Worried about Eli's mental state, Clare becomes overprotective. Katie wants Jake back, but is it too late? Jenna must choose between two guys.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After Drew moves out, there's a break-in at the loft, and Fiona fears for her safety. Someone from Dallas' past pays him a surprise visit. A tough assignment forces Zig to think about his mistakes.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Fiona takes drastic measures to feel safer at home, and puts herself in danger. Dallas avoids telling Alli the truth about his past.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Maya lets loose at a party and posts a video online, hoping it'll change her image. The battle for the student council presidency heats up when Drew enters the race.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After a stressful audition, Maya tosses her cello in the trash, and decides to have more fun. The competition between Drew and Clare intensifies. Connor offers Eli some advice about love.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: The Time of My Life, Pt. 1
programme.desc: Imogen can't imagine saying good-bye to Fiona and resorts to desperate measures to try keep them together.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: The Time of My Life, Pt. 2
programme.desc: Imogen can't imagine saying good-bye to Fiona and resorts to desperate measures to try keep them together.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A few lucky students are bound for a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Paris, accompanied by some fresh new faces.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A few lucky students are bound for a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Paris, accompanied by some fresh new faces.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Despite her illness, Clare is determined to remain a regular girl. Alli is lonely in Paris and tries to make the best of it without her BF and Tristan tries to 'bro' up while rooming with the guys.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Clare receives crushing news while waiting for her MRI results. Needing time away from the hospital, Clare convinces Drew to help her escape.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Why is Becky blowing Adam off to spend time with Todd? Who's Todd? Adam is not liking this long distance relationship thing.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Adam takes Dallas' advice and tries juggling two girls at once. But he's not that kind of guy. When upset Tristan goes AWOL in Paris, Maya enlists her sworn enemy for help find him.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Leo and Alli are getting to feel really serious. Distraught Drew needs to visit camp for comfort. Maya must show up Zoë and puts an expensive dress on her mother's credit card.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: As summer comes to an end, Becky tries to understand the meaning behind an unexpected tragedy. Working to rally Degrassi together, Becky orchestrates an evening to remember.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: This Is How We Do It
programme.desc: After the devastating loss of Adam, the students try their best to move on but when it's your brother.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Drew does his best as Degrassi President but without sleep, he's not much good. By Drew's side, Zoë becomes the first lady of Degrassi. Leo does damage control and tries to get in with Alli's friends.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The opportunity to write for a magazine is offered to Clare but her brain after cancer is not cooperating.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Clare tries to excuses to save her reputation with the magazine but doesn't want to play the cancer card.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Focusing more on her music than Miles, Maya lets Zoë talk her into making a sexy music video.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Miles helps Maya discover who is behind her video going viral. Maya's hellbent on revenge. Hiding her bruise under make-up, Alli tries to focus on her SATs and bury her problems with Leo.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Student council prez Drew is psyched about his Degrassi TV interview but when the story sheds a negative light, Drew's stunned. Clare can't wait to see Eli, in town for a quick visit.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Drew is excited to have Bianca back in town for Thanksgiving but is surprised when she isn't as forthcoming as he expected. Eli and Clare try to work through their long distance challenges.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: It's Alli's birthday, but all she can think about is Leo being sent back to France. Maya returns from suspension, only to find she'll be stuck in a new class with a former friend.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Alli is still lying to protect Leo, but her stories are beginning to unravel . Maya shows her rubber room classmates that she isn't a princess.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Drew attempts juggling his new job and his new girl. To forget about Leo, Alli focusses on her science experiment.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Failing at balancing his life, Drew decides he has to break up with Zoë. Alli partners up with Dallas in an attempt to stay focused on her science experiment.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A shocking discovery leads Miles to question his family life. Eli is slipping away, and Clare finds herself growing closer to Drew.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: With rumours swirling about Zoë's drunken adventures at a recent party, Becky files a DTV report about teen girls and alcohol.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Becky wants to put things right after making a false accusation about Zoë's assault. But once she discovers the truth, Becky questions if she's doing the right thing.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Maya tries to help Zig out of a tough situation. Jenna sets her sights on winning the semi-formal king and queen crowns with Connor.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Becky tries to get back in bestie rhythm with Imogen at the semi-formal, but is there more to their relationship than friendship? Miles goes to extreme lengths when he worries he'll lose Maya to Zig.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Dallas feels he's being racially profiled after he and Connor are held for questioning.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Tristan confronts Mr. Yates about his Drama class criticisms and finds out the shocking truth behind them.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: When Zoë lands her dream role, it hits a little too close to home following her assault. Clare has some tough decisions to make as she searches for a date to Wild Wild West Night.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Fireworks begin at Wild Wild West Night when Clare makes her decision known with regards to Drew and Eli.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Maya is doing her best to keep Zig safe but when she finds a bag of drugs, her worst fears are confirmed.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Hiding Zig out at the Matlin house while the Maya organizes the Art Night seems to be working... for now.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Becky feels isolated at home since helping turn in her brother. Looking for a distraction, she finds her escape in online gaming.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: When Tristan asks Mr. Yates for some help, Mr. Yates suggests he come to his apartment for some extra help.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Zoë's trial begins and when she fears that she is being painted in a harsh light, she takes matters into her own hands.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Will a superstorm headed for Toronto stall a Degrassi dance? Maya, Zig & Zoë plan to attend but get stranded at the Matlin house. Even wIth the power out, sparks still fly.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Clare is forced to spend the night with Eli while in New York City. Maya and Zoë seek refuge in The Dot with nothing to do but sort out their rivalry. Drew searches for missing Becky.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Clare has a serious dilemma that will affect her entire future and confides in Alli and Jenna. Zoë sees red when Becky tells her she's too much of a distraction for the power cheer team.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Frankie isn't a little girl anymore! She thinks it's unfair that women are expected to show their bodies to men and get nothing in return.

programme.sub-title: Can't Stop This Thing We Started
programme.desc: Clare has to muster up the courage to tell Eli about her situation. Winston is making some headway with Frankie but is insecure about his friendship with Miles. Is he losing him to Tristan?

programme.desc: Becky and her brother Luke's relationship is very strained and even with her faith as strong as it is, she can't bring herself to forgive him.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Maya can't sleep. She's having nightmares about Miles' safety, and they're becoming all too familiar.

programme.desc: Drew is committed to keeping Becky happy but his situation with Clare has his attention divided. Maya lies in order to protect Miles, but the guilt is eating her up.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Winston is set to play the lead in his musical but is not pleased that Lola could star opposite him. The musical seems to be the perfect distraction from Zig's problems.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: It's Frankie's birthday, and she's going to celebrate it, Hollingsworth style -- with a Gatsby party!

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Maya has someone on her mind, and is questioning the house rules Mrs. Matlin has set. Clare embarks on an impromptu road trip to New York, along with an unwitting passenger.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Prom is fast approaching, but Clare is MIA from committee meetings. Alli's worried she could be hiding something. Zig moves in with Tiny and is finding it hard to adjust.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Zig is hesitant to let Maya see his new place. Clare discovers something fishy has been going on at the school, and decides to expose it.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.desc: It's prom time at Degrassi and in a last-minute shot to save his night, Drew plans an elaborate prom-posal. Dallas wants Prom to be perfect for Alli but he makes a mistake that could ruin everything.

programme.desc: Drew agrees to help Dallas salvage Prom and is punished. Imogen has managed to win Jack back, but her happiness is fleeting. Clare is still unsure of her future plans.

programme.desc: Zoe attempts to ward off her feelings for an unlikely candidate by leaning into a romance a familiar face. Frankie hasn't heard from Logan since she gave him the money for Gloria's rescue.

programme.desc: After months of flirting via e-mail, thirteen year-old Emma's new love interest, Jordan, is going to be in town. Coincidentally (fatefully?), it's the same night as her mother's high school reunion.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: When Sean asks Emma what she's doing tonight, Emma's thrilled - that's a date, right? But nervous Sean is unable to muster the courage to arrange the details and Emma sees his hesitancy as rejection.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: When Paige decides to start a Spirit Squad, Emma can't believe that the sport of cheerleading is revived.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Ashley's convinced that she and Terri are going to be the stars of the school talent show, singing her new ballad. Terri would rather add Paige to the act, but she's not sure how to tell Ashley that.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Faced with the pressure of passing Grade 7 on his second time around and his mother's newest threat to take him back to his unhappy life up north, Sean is beginning to slip into old, angry patterns.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Perfect Ashley is beginning to bore even herself. With their parents away for the weekend, Ashley decides to join Toby in breaking the "one-guest-each" rule and invites friends to join her and Terri.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Summer's over and the Degrassi kids are back...in droves. A neighbouring high school has been amalgamated with the Junior High and things are a bit of a zoo.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: When Spike reveals the identity of the mystery man she's been dating, Emma is shocked. Mr. Simpson - her teacher!

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Ashley feels like an outcast. Nobody's willing to forget how she treated them at her party last year.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Degrassi has a new star soccer player, Spinner. His victory's even sweeter when Paige agrees to a movie.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Haunted by memories of her recent sexual assault, Paige is desperately trying to appear normal. A girl band contest sounds like a great distraction.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Toby is tired of being an invisible computer geek so he decides to join a sports team. Girls love wrestlers - that includes Toby's crush Kendra.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Manny's crush on Craig has reached huge proportions and everyone's urging her to ask him out already!

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Grade Nine International Day is coming up and Hazel isn't thrilled. After all, Hazel's Jamaican and everybody loves the islands - right?

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Emma is reveling in her newest job as her mom's maid of honour and planner extraordinaire! Her mom is marrying her high-school crush, Snake - who also just happens to be Emma's favourite teacher.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Emma is reveling in her newest job as her mom's maid of honour and planner extraordinaire! Her mom is marrying her high-school crush, Snake - who also just happens to be Emma's favourite teacher.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Marco and Ellie are the best of friends. But Ellie is starting to want more...Marco though can't seem to respond in kind. He's more and more confused about what and who he's looking for.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: When class clown JT acts up in Science class, his teacher Ms. Hatzilakos gives him a serious detention.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Liberty can't believe it when she doesn't make the Girls Floor Hockey team - she's never failed at anything.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Ashley and Jimmy are back together, but it doesn't feel quite the same. Ash may not look the same as last year - she's a Goth now - but Jimmy's sure she's still the same golden girl inside.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Emma's mom is away for a few days and it's just her and her step-dad, Mr. Simpson. He's supportive of Emma's involvement in "Food for Thought".

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After being in counselling for a long time, Paige is positive she's recovered from her date rape. In fact, she's convinced her life is back to normal - Dean and what he did are behind her forever.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: It's exam time and everyone's stressed - especially Craig. In a surprise visit from his father, Craig learns that his dad is very eager to have him back in his life.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Although his father is gone, Craig wants to get on with his life as normal. He insists on going back to school immediately and becomes frustrated with his friends when they behave with concern.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants take part in death-defying, stomach-churning stunts. This time, it's jumping between two suspended platforms, a spin at barbershop roulette, and an explosive container launch.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants must find keys in a tank of snakes, play target shooting to see how many beetles they must eat, and bob in a tank for pig hearts.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants would be required to strip down to their birthday suits, parade along the runway for one minute.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants must walk around a 12 inch perimeter while an apparatus which is turning raised in the air, fastest time without falling wins. After that its the Eel tank and Heli Rodeo.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.sub-title: Blind Date Fear Factor: Take Two
programme.desc: Contestants take part in death-defying, stomach-churning stunts. This time, it's being weighed down underwater, digging into rotten picnic snacks, and a tag-team challenge on a moving train.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Players willshimmy up poles, bob for gross objects in cheese and perform daring driving stunts.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: This episode featured six celebrity contestants competing for charity. The winner would receive $50,000 for their charity, and the others would receive 10,000 dollars for their charities.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants must race to milk a goat with their mouths, and unlock themselves from a box which let's them fall from a helicopter.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants will be lying on their backs in a muddy trough on the roof of a building. On "go" the contestants will be dragged through the mud and must pluck as many flags as they can before dropping off the edge of the building.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestant must rope-swing between high platforms, play a slot machine which selects eyeballs for them to eat, and slide down the outside of the Luxor Hotel.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants take part in death-defying, stomach-churning stunts. This time, it's facing hurricane wind and rain on top of a building, bobbing for cockroaches, and a river runs.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: In this episode we see stunts including the Wrecking Ball, Buffalo Testicles and Submerged Car.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: In this episode we see stunts including the Jet Ski to Helicopter, Eat Beetles and Rope Crawl

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants must climb hand over hand around the skids of a moving helicopter, move maggots with their mouths, and attempt to flip their car the furthest on a pipe ramp.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants take part in death-defying, stomach-churning stunts. This time, it's a suspended shoulder stand, facing off with a very dirty kitchen sink, and driving under a moving semi-truck.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0 USA
programme.desc: Four teams of exes must deal with 3 stunts and each other in order to win $50,000

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants must jump between two moving flatbed trucks, lie in a coffin filled with worms, and be tumbled in a giant cylinder over water.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: In this couples stunt, the contestants will be standing on opposite platforms suspended 100 feet in the air. Contestants will have to siphon gross fluid (worms, crickets, cow parts, pig parts etc) out of 4 containers and into a large funnel.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Miss USA Episode - Players will fall from platforms, eat sea cucumber and hang from bars until they drop.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Players will contend with extreme monkey bars, leech coffins, and ride a quad off a 100ft cliff

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants take part in death-defying, stomach-churning stunts. This time, it's an upside-down dual dunk and an endurance isolation challenge with bad smells, sounds, and more.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants are dunked by a helicopter, transport disgusting items from a conveyor belt, and fight to stay inside a human hamster wheel.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants take part in death-defying, stomach-churning stunts. This time, it's a partner challenge hanging from a helicopter, a box filled with alligators and frogs, and launching a quad off a pier.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: This 30-minute clip show had highlights from animal stunts featured in the first three seasons of Fear Factor. Clips included worms, rats, snakes, bulls, bees, attack dogs, alligators, Madagascar hissing cockroaches, and scorpions.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants take part in death-defying, stomach-churning stunts. This time, it's a helicopter net climb from a fireboat, shots of habanero followed by throwing flares, and a 60-foot fire slide into an ice-covered pool.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants must stand on a truck as it drives through a tunnel, hit targets to avoid eating bugs, and dodge eing flipped by a tractor.

programme.title: Fear Factor USA
programme.desc: Contestants will will have to put out a fire and rescue a dummy from its bed, lay in a pit while 3,000 scorpions are dropped on them. And climb a platform which flips end over end.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a decomposed body is found stuffed in a barrel, it's easy to presume murder. But the body had been placed in the barrel 30 years earlier. One of the few clues was an address book found along with the body.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This examination of the role autopsies play in investigations on the suspicious death of Virginia Ridley.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police find the body of 11-year-old Krista Harrison, there are few clues to the killer's identity. But authorities are intrigued by unusual orange fibers embedded in clothing found near the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Edward Post drew a bath for his wife before going for a run. He returned to find her not breathing. She died before emergency response arrived. Police considered her death accidental until a motive surfaced.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Mark Fair left for work and his fiancée, Karla Brown, stayed home. Later, he found her dead. During the autopsy, bite marks on her body were re-examined and forensic odontology identified the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Robert Sims returned home from work and found his wife unconscious on the kitchen floor. Their two-year-old son was asleep in an upstairs bedroom, but their six-week-old daughter was missing.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The doctors at the hospital couldn't determine the cause of Bobby Curley's hallucinations and intense pain. They treated it as a neurological disorder but his condition deteriorated. He was being poisoned.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Young Navajos in the Southwest were dying at an alarming rate. The tribe's medicine men provided investigators with a critical clue that would lead halfway around the world to a most unlikely killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On a windy Kansas night in 1995, a mysterious fire swept through the home of a prominent doctor. In the debris, investigators found evidence which told them how the fire started.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When heart surgeon Darryl Sutorius is found dead in the basement of his upscale Cincinnati home, police assume he committed suicide. Further investigation reveals that his new wife Della has a history of violence and an insatiable desire for money.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a policeman's house goes up in flames, experts suspect arson. The officer whose home was torched arrests low-level drug dealer James Wren, who confesses. But when the suspect vanishes, investigators question the authenticity of the confession.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1980s, bodies of nude woman were found on remote hill of California. The police got a break when a known prostitute escaped an attacker and was able to identify him and his automobile.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Eleven-month-old Chad Shelton was admitted to the hospital with unexplained bleeding and later died. Investigators and scientists frantically search for a cause.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Edward Honaker was convicted of rape, sodomy and aggravated sexual battery; he was sentenced to three life terms in prison. Honaker steadfastly maintained his innocence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Janice Johnson was found dead at the foot of her basement stairs. Police in Nova Scotia had to unravel the circumstances surrounding Janice's death and answer the question: Was it an accident or murder?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When convenience store employee Wanda Mason is found dead, investigators find the entire murder has been caught on the store's security camera. But the image of the killer is so degraded it seems impossible to positively identify him.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police investigate a missing college girl and discover her double life: attending school by day and working as a call-girl by night. Her body is found and investigators find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A two-year-old boy was rushed to the hospital suffering from brain seizures and breathing difficulties.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Joann Katrinak is found dead in a corn field with her infant son, the obvious suspect is the husband.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation of a pediatrician, prompted by the mysterious death of one of her patients, leads to a Texas hospital where the pediatric mortality rate is higher than at any hospital in the country.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Sometime during a neighborhood Christmas party, five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared. Investigators turned to forensic science to help them see what the witnesses missed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Stephen Scher and Martin Dillon went skeet shooting on a beautiful Spring day. Martin was shot dead but his friend maintained it was a freak accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In this classic episode of Forensic Files, the longest running true crime series in television history, a serial bomber was waging a vendetta against the legal profession.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The doctors at the hospital couldn't determine the cause of Bobby Curley's hallucinations and intense pain. They treated it as a neurological disorder but his condition deteriorated. He was being poisoned.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the wife of a well-known dentist is found dead, police struggle to identify a suspect. Some fibers and a study of the weather patterns on the night of the murder break the case open and reveal the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a human skull and some bones were discovered at a Boy Scout Camp near Farmington, Missouri. A facial reconstruction aided the investigators in this case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1992, Laura Houghteling disappeared from her Bethesda home and was never seen again. Laura's bedroom was searched and forensic science was used to direct them a to prime suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On a cold December night in 1993, Rose Larner stopped in a convenience store on her way to her boyfriend's house. She was never seen or heard from again.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, police received a call from Darlie Routier telling them of her two sons' murders. The police found the killer by analyzing blood spatter, doing behavioral profiling and analyzing Darlie's 911 call.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular gym teacher is found dead of what appears to be an accidental gunshot wound, his family is suspicious. A tape recorded by the victim just before his death tells the true story of his strange marriage and his wife's insatiable greed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In this international case of extortion, murder and stolen identities, scam-artist Albert J. Walker assumes the identity of co-worker Ronald Platt. Platt later turns up dead in an ocean with an anchor tied around his torso.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: 6-year-old Nicole Rae Walker was killed in a hit-and-run in her Ft. Lauderdale neighborhood. The prosecutor combines the talents of an accident reconstruction expert with a video specialist to create a graphic demonstration of the moment of impact.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nancy Newman and her two daughters are found brutally murdered. The crime scene has no shortage of evidence, but investigators cannot find a conclusive link to their prime suspect. To solve the puzzle, an FBI analyst designs a unique experiment.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, more than a dozen children in Seattle, Washington, were fighting for their lives. Each one of them had contracted a serious unknown illness. After one died, investigators knew the clock was ticking.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This examination of the role autopsies play in investigations on the suspicious death of Virginia Ridley.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Young Navajos in the Southwest were dying at an alarming rate. The tribe's medicine men provided investigators with a critical clue that would lead halfway around the world to a most unlikely killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Robert Sims returned home from work and found his wife unconscious on the kitchen floor. Their two-year-old son was asleep in an upstairs bedroom, but their six-week-old daughter was missing.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On September 17, 1984, eight-year-old Vicki Hoskins left home on her pink bicycle and never returned.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Who was the sexual offender who murdered two adolescent boys in Nebraska? The key to stopping him would be the unique composition of the "junk rope" he used to tie his victims.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When four month-old Ryan Stallings died under suspicious circumstances, his mother was ultimately convicted of his murder. But months later new evidence emerged from a startling source.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Fire engulfs the home where Lori Keidel and her siblings were left alone while their father went to the laundromat. Years after her mother's disappearance, Lori tells police she witnessed her mother's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On a windy Kansas night in 1995, a mysterious fire swept through the home of a prominent doctor. In the debris, investigators found evidence which told them how the fire started.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1990, Shirley Andronowich's body was found mutilated. Eyewitnesses told police she had a fight with her husband the night before, but forensic evidence proved that he had nothing to do with her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Mark Fair left for work and his fiancée, Karla Brown, stayed home. Later, he found her dead. During the autopsy, bite marks on her body were re-examined and forensic odontology identified the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Edward Post drew a bath for his wife before going for a run. He returned to find her not breathing. She died before emergency response arrived. Police considered her death accidental until a motive surfaced.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Women in a Louisiana city live in fear of a rapist who leaves no clues to his identity. But technology and behavioral science combine to give police a new forensic tool. Police narrow their search to one man: local policeman Randy Comeaux.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Survivors of Nazi atrocities recognized Archbishop Trifa, former head of the Romanian Orthodox Church in America, as having directed a bloody attack against Jews during World War II. He was deported in 1984 and died three years later.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a decomposed body is found stuffed in a barrel, it's easy to presume murder. But the body had been placed in the barrel 30 years earlier. One of the few clues was an address book found along with the body.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police suspect Dr. John "Jack" Boyle in the disappearance of his wife, Noreen, when he signs mortgage papers for a new house with a woman pretending to be his spouse. The police later find Noreen's body in the basement of Dr. Boyle's new house.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the decomposed body of a teenage girl is discovered, police have no clues to her identity. To solve the case, investigators turn to bug larvae found on the body and a tiny wad of chewing gum found near the victim's body.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police find the body of 11-year-old Krista Harrison, there are few clues to the killer's identity. But authorities are intrigued by unusual orange fibers embedded in clothing found near the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Robert Sims returned home from work and found his wife unconscious on the kitchen floor. Their two-year-old son was asleep in an upstairs bedroom, but their six-week-old daughter was missing.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Edward Honaker was convicted of rape, sodomy and aggravated sexual battery; he was sentenced to three life terms in prison. Honaker steadfastly maintained his innocence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Joann Katrinak is found dead in a corn field with her infant son, the obvious suspect is the husband.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1980s, bodies of nude woman were found on remote hill of California. The police got a break when a known prostitute escaped an attacker and was able to identify him and his automobile.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Fire engulfs the home where Lori Keidel and her siblings were left alone while their father went to the laundromat. Years after her mother's disappearance, Lori tells police she witnessed her mother's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When convenience store employee Wanda Mason is found dead, investigators find the entire murder has been caught on the store's security camera. But the image of the killer is so degraded it seems impossible to positively identify him.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1990, Shirley Andronowich's body was found mutilated. Eyewitnesses told police she had a fight with her husband the night before, but forensic evidence proved that he had nothing to do with her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This examination of the role autopsies play in investigations on the suspicious death of Virginia Ridley.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, police received a call from Darlie Routier telling them of her two sons' murders. The police found the killer by analyzing blood spatter, doing behavioral profiling and analyzing Darlie's 911 call.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a decomposed body is found stuffed in a barrel, it's easy to presume murder. But the body had been placed in the barrel 30 years earlier. One of the few clues was an address book found along with the body.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When heart surgeon Darryl Sutorius is found dead in the basement of his upscale Cincinnati home, police assume he committed suicide. Further investigation reveals that his new wife Della has a history of violence and an insatiable desire for money.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation of a pediatrician, prompted by the mysterious death of one of her patients, leads to a Texas hospital where the pediatric mortality rate is higher than at any hospital in the country.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular gym teacher is found dead of what appears to be an accidental gunshot wound, his family is suspicious. A tape recorded by the victim just before his death tells the true story of his strange marriage and his wife's insatiable greed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, more than a dozen children in Seattle, Washington, were fighting for their lives. Each one of them had contracted a serious unknown illness. After one died, investigators knew the clock was ticking.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The doctors at the hospital couldn't determine the cause of Bobby Curley's hallucinations and intense pain. They treated it as a neurological disorder but his condition deteriorated. He was being poisoned.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1992, Laura Houghteling disappeared from her Bethesda home and was never seen again. Laura's bedroom was searched and forensic science was used to direct them a to prime suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a policeman's house goes up in flames, experts suspect arson. The officer whose home was torched arrests low-level drug dealer James Wren, who confesses. But when the suspect vanishes, investigators question the authenticity of the confession.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On a cold December night in 1993, Rose Larner stopped in a convenience store on her way to her boyfriend's house. She was never seen or heard from again.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A two-year-old boy was rushed to the hospital suffering from brain seizures and breathing difficulties.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Women in a Louisiana city live in fear of a rapist who leaves no clues to his identity. But technology and behavioral science combine to give police a new forensic tool. Police narrow their search to one man: local policeman Randy Comeaux.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Stephen Scher and Martin Dillon went skeet shooting on a beautiful Spring day. Martin was shot dead but his friend maintained it was a freak accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In this classic episode of Forensic Files, the longest running true crime series in television history, a serial bomber was waging a vendetta against the legal profession.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In this international case of extortion, murder and stolen identities, scam-artist Albert J. Walker assumes the identity of co-worker Ronald Platt. Platt later turns up dead in an ocean with an anchor tied around his torso.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police suspect Dr. John "Jack" Boyle in the disappearance of his wife, Noreen, when he signs mortgage papers for a new house with a woman pretending to be his spouse. The police later find Noreen's body in the basement of Dr. Boyle's new house.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Mark Fair left for work and his fiancée, Karla Brown, stayed home. Later, he found her dead. During the autopsy, bite marks on her body were re-examined and forensic odontology identified the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On September 17, 1984, eight-year-old Vicki Hoskins left home on her pink bicycle and never returned.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a human skull and some bones were discovered at a Boy Scout Camp near Farmington, Missouri. A facial reconstruction aided the investigators in this case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the decomposed body of a teenage girl is discovered, police have no clues to her identity. To solve the case, investigators turn to bug larvae found on the body and a tiny wad of chewing gum found near the victim's body.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police find the body of 11-year-old Krista Harrison, there are few clues to the killer's identity. But authorities are intrigued by unusual orange fibers embedded in clothing found near the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Janice Johnson was found dead at the foot of her basement stairs. Police in Nova Scotia had to unravel the circumstances surrounding Janice's death and answer the question: Was it an accident or murder?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Young Navajos in the Southwest were dying at an alarming rate. The tribe's medicine men provided investigators with a critical clue that would lead halfway around the world to a most unlikely killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the wife of a well-known dentist is found dead, police struggle to identify a suspect. Some fibers and a study of the weather patterns on the night of the murder break the case open and reveal the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Who was the sexual offender who murdered two adolescent boys in Nebraska? The key to stopping him would be the unique composition of the "junk rope" he used to tie his victims.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Edward Post drew a bath for his wife before going for a run. He returned to find her not breathing. She died before emergency response arrived. Police considered her death accidental until a motive surfaced.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: "Ukuli Bula" is a bull jumping ceremony. The idea is to jump three times over a series of bulls lined up in a row, without falling over. If the young man, or Ukuli fails, he will be mocked by the village and will not be able to marry.

programme.title: Green Paradise
programme.sub-title: Tasmania - The Island on the Edge of the World

programme.title: The Toque 12
programme.desc: Chef and Owner Ryan Clift prepares more of the Tippling Club's signature dishes and drinks. Phil is then treated to the restaurant's extensive degustation menu that typifies Tippling's ever-evolving dining experience.

programme.title: Curious Traveler
programme.desc: Why the French settled in Montreal; Paris Metro stop; why Notre-Dame Basilica is blue; Hotel de Ville; Bank of Montreal; whether there really is an archaeological dig underfoot at Place Royal.

programme.title: Traveling with Denella Ri'chard
programme.desc: Alaska is the land of the midnight sun and the Northern Lights. A place with abundant wildlife, and ample land for them to roam. Here, the air is fresh and clear, and the grasses evergreen. Join Denella on a trek by land and sea to Alaska.

programme.title: Smart Travels with Rudy Maxa
programme.desc: From Nice to St. Tropez, we drop in on the hot spots along the Mediterranean's famous Cote d'Azur. Based in lively Nice, we visit the local beaches and superb modern art museums featuring works by Matisse, Picasso and Signac.

programme.title: Fantastic Festivals of the World
programme.desc: Every year in June or July, millions of Hindus throughout India celebrate one of the oldest festivals in the world honoring the deities of Jagannath, Balaram and Subhadra. Beautifully decorated chariots are pulled through Puri's main street.

programme.title: Taste Hunters
programme.desc: Canada is home to crystal lakes, healthy forests, and wide-open spaces. Originally famous for its single-crop farming and the industrialization of certain crops, the concept of local agriculture has taken on new meaning the last few years.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: Renowned for its history of marble sculpting, and home to remarkable flavors, Tinos is magical. Follow Diane as she visits a famous local marble sculptor, learns a few secrets from an old friend, and creates traditional Tinos specialties.

programme.title: Savour Australia
programme.desc: In Sydney, Jason takes part in some cooking at the award-winning Marque restaurant and meets with an up-and-coming pastry chef at The Blackstar Pastry. For some fun activities, he tries grape stomping and quad biking.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: San Sebastian: A Food Lover's Town
programme.desc: San Sebastian, Spain: Tony explores the food-crazed Basque culture. Tony's guide, Chef Luis Irizar, takes Tony into the underworld of Basque gastronomic societies. Later, Tony explores the citys tapas bars.

programme.title: Tastes Like Home
programme.desc: Oonagh and Ethel's most vivid childhood memories include Aunt Bernadette's Beef Stew. In Carrick-on-Suir, Ethel teaches Catherine the handiwork behind the delectable Irish stew before Catherine delivers the recipe to Oonagh in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Andiamo Uptown
programme.desc: Soccer legend Cobi Jones joins Donna and her daughter for fun and adventure in Phuket, Thailand.

programme.title: Xtreme Tourist
programme.desc: Ernie finds Utah's best mountain biking in the red sandstone landscape; gunfights at the Bar-M Chuckwagon; rappelling from Corona Arch; and four-wheel Jeeping Hell's Revenge.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.sub-title: The Splendor of Yucatán's Enchanting Markets
programme.desc: Federico Lopez, one of Mexico's most talented chefs, joins Rick at the enchanting Mercado Municipal to extol the virtues of unique Yucatecan produce. They also visit Temozón for smoked meats, and with their basket full, it is time to cook.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Ever dream of owning a winery? Don and Tru Miller made their dreams come true when they built Adobe Guadalupe. Rick's dream of cooking in their stunning kitchen, with its handmade wood-fired oven, comes true this season. Dream on.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Rick discusses Chef Pedro Abascal's reliance on local farms to supply his hotel restaurants, before visiting a lamb farm in Tizimín, and C-Grill restaurant. In Chicago, Rick heads to the outdoor Green City Market to gather ingredients.

programme.title: Great Family Adventures
programme.desc: Learn the traditions of the annual Saguaro Fruit Harvest with the Tohono O'odham Indian Nation. Discover the wildlife of the Sonoran Desert, and enjoy some of the tastiest plants that grow there.

programme.title: Dates that Made History
programme.sub-title: The Birth of the French Republic (June 20, 1789 A.D.)

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Who do Mexico City's top chefs believe will be the next great chef to emerge from Mexico? Pablo Salas. The odd thing is, Salas does not work in Mexico City. His restaurant, Amaranta, is in Toluca, and Rick travels to meet him there.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: The Mercado Lazaro Cardenas is standard as far as markets in Mexico City go, but turn one corner, and you are in the world of coffee geeks, of which Rick is a proud citizen. Rick also meets with mixologists Joseph Mortera and Ricardo Nava.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.sub-title: Off the Beaten Path in Huatulco
programme.desc: Mexico's beaches glimmer with pristine perfection. Chef Rick Bayless takes us off the beaten path to find great food and even better beaches such as Playa Chahue and Playa Principal. You would be well-advised to follow his lead.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Chocolatier Mathieu Brees and Rick travel into the jungles of Ticul for a tour of cacao groves, then to the Ki' Xocolatl chocolate factory in Merida. After all that chocolate daydreaming, Rick makes a trio of cacao-inspired dishes.

programme.title: Family on the Road
programme.desc: In Thailand, Martin's family discovers the importance of mangroves and the ecosystem that they preserve.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Oaxaca has long been known for its seven moles, unparalleled home-cooking, and remarkable market fare. Lately, its restaurant reputation has skyrocketed, too. Deservedly so. Rick visits four of the top chef contenders in Oaxaca City.

programme.title: The New Environmentalists
programme.desc: Zambia and Eswatini (formerly Swaziland) represent two divergent strategies on environmentalism. Meet people from both countries and learn of the successes, failures, and sacrifices they experienced seeking environmental justice.

programme.title: Great Family Adventures
programme.desc: See Nevada's Cathedral Gorge, Beaver Dam, and Berlin-Ichthyosaur Park. Explore wetlands and Native American rock art. Learn about turquoise and discover some ancient aquatic creatures - some fossilized, and some still alive today!

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Fish tacos embody Ensenada's history: Fresh fish from pristine waters encased in crispy batter influenced by Asian immigrants, topped with Spanish-inspired creamy sauces, wrapped in a very Mexican corn tortilla, and spiked with chile.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.sub-title: Cooking on the Sea of Cortez
programme.desc: Rick is always up for a cooking challenge, and after a day on the waters of the Sea of Cortez, Rick grills dinner for the group on the beach of Espiritu Santo island. To stock up on supplies Rick shops in the La Paz market for ingredients.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Join Rick and winemaker Hugo d'Acosta as they toast the world-class wines of Baja California Norte. Hugo first introduces Rick his Casa de Piedra wines before moving on to Tres Mujeres, L.A. Cetto, and the San Rafael Winery.

programme.title: Great Family Adventures
programme.desc: Visit a working cattle ranch and then take to the skies at the annual Ruby Mountain Balloon festival. Enjoy Cowboy poetry, learn about Basque culture, dig for opals, and fish for bass.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.sub-title: Eat Like a Local in Los Cabos
programme.desc: Ever travel to a tourist mecca and wonder what the locals eat? Join Rick and his friend Hugo to find the best Mexican food in Los Cabos. First stop is the municipal market in San Jose del Cabo, then they enjoy carnitas at Los Michoacános.

programme.title: The New Environmentalists
programme.desc: Biodiversity is a central component to the successful operation of Earth's natural systems. Meet people from Haiti, Myanmar, Honduras, Kenya, Canada, and Scotland who spend time and energy securing healthy local environmental regulations.

programme.title: The New Environmentalists
programme.desc: The value of Earth's natural resources changes depending on to whom you speak. Meet people from France, Colombia, Vietnam, South Africa, the Philippines, and Michigan who have circumvented extraordinary challenges to protect the Earth.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Everything tastes better when cooked over a fire, at least that is the Oaxacan credo. From soup to barbacoa, fiery embers influence the flavor of Oaxaca's food in just the right ways. Join Rick in Oaxaca, San Felipe Usila, and Zaachilla.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Chef and Author David Sterling takes Rick on an inspiring whirlwind tour of the Yucatán peninsula, including to the rustic wood-burning ovens at Panadería Liz in Merida. Then, it is back to the gorgeous kitchen at Los Dos Cooking School.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: There is a long heritage of good food in Tijuana. The city has an amazing taco, culture and is the birthplace of the Caesar salad. Today, Tijuana boasts one of the top culinary schools in the country and some of the best chefs in Mexico.

programme.title: Great Family Adventures
programme.desc: Explore the wonders of the animal migration within a monarch butterfly grove and an elephant seal sanctuary. Learn about the California condors and visit a redwood forest.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Chef Edgar Nuñez wants to change the world. Like Rick, Edgar believes everyone should have access to fresh, local food, that Mexican chefs should embrace their own cuisine, and that mentoring the younger generation is very important.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: In the Italian countryside, we'll see how prosciutto and pecorino are made, duck into ancient wine cellars, and visit the hill town of Assisi - and its awe-inspiring basilica.

programme.title: Elizabeth Stanton's Great Big World
programme.desc: There are myriad ways to have fun in the Bahamas, and Elizabeth, Taylor, Jennifer, and Rob reveal places you must visit. The four also go deep-sea fishing, feed wild stingrays, dive underwater in unique submersibles, and go ocean tubing.

programme.title: Wild Travels
programme.desc: Get the lead out at Orlando Speed World, and tour soda heaven at Pops 66 Soda Ranch on Route 66. Also, meet Artist and Farmer Ruby C. Williams, discover fine brew at The Church Brew Works, and visit the amazing Bread and Puppet Theater.

programme.title: Smart Travels with Rudy Maxa
programme.desc: The city of Rouen; cider and cheese; the site of the D-Day invasion.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: On this culinary odyssey to Lefkada, Diane discovers Greece's tastiest lentils, rosewater vinegar, and the art of embroidery. Back in her kitchen, Diane prepares a bevy of flavorful dishes that are indicative of Ionian cuisine.

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: Tel Aviv is a vibrant and striking blend of old and new. From the ancient port of Jaffa to modern skyscrapers and trendy nightclubs, Tel Aviv is the epicenter of Israel's arts scene and most of the country's top musicians live here.

programme.title: Tastes Like Home
programme.desc: James, Monica, and their families cannot believe how inspirational it was to taste flavors from Ireland after Catherine successfully prepares an incredible meal for them, followed by two deserts made from their mother Ann's own recipes.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Morocco (Sahara) Tony traverses the Moroccan desert with one goal in mind: eat a mud-oven-roasted sheep.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: Mickela gets up close and personal with the locals as she heads to Buenos Aires, Argentina to learn the seductive dance of tango. From attending the world's largest tango festival to dancing on the city's main stage, Mickela sees it all.

programme.title: Curious Traveler
programme.desc: Why the French settled in Montreal; Paris Metro stop; why Notre-Dame Basilica is blue; Hotel de Ville; Bank of Montreal; whether there really is an archaeological dig underfoot at Place Royal.

programme.title: The Toque 12
programme.desc: Chef and Owner Ryan Clift prepares more of the Tippling Club's signature dishes and drinks. Phil is then treated to the restaurant's extensive degustation menu that typifies Tippling's ever-evolving dining experience.

programme.title: Taste Hunters
programme.desc: Canada is home to crystal lakes, healthy forests, and wide-open spaces. Originally famous for its single-crop farming and the industrialization of certain crops, the concept of local agriculture has taken on new meaning the last few years.

programme.title: Fantastic Festivals of the World
programme.desc: Every year in June or July, millions of Hindus throughout India celebrate one of the oldest festivals in the world honoring the deities of Jagannath, Balaram and Subhadra. Beautifully decorated chariots are pulled through Puri's main street.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Chocolatier Mathieu Brees and Rick travel into the jungles of Ticul for a tour of cacao groves, then to the Ki' Xocolatl chocolate factory in Merida. After all that chocolate daydreaming, Rick makes a trio of cacao-inspired dishes.

programme.title: Mexico: One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: In the Yucatán, cooking over fire is a way of life, and Chefs Juan Pablo Loza, Federico Lopez, and Eric Werner demonstrate their mastery cooking with flame. Back at Lena Brava in Chicago, Rick prepares spatchcock chicken al oregano.

programme.title: Smart Travels with Rudy Maxa
programme.desc: Australia's stunning metropolis, Sydney seduces with its glorious harbor, carefree attitude and sunny beaches. From the Opera house to the Harbor Bridge to Circular Quay Rudy basks in the sights along the harbor.

programme.title: Savour Australia
programme.desc: Jason experiences Brisbane, a city with a beautiful Public Art Trail, and he also travels to Noosa to enjoy its Night Markets. Acclaimed chef Peter Kuruvita then teaches Jason how to cook a classic Sri Lankan dish.

programme.title: Culinary Travels With Dave Eckert
programme.desc: Explore the methods winemakers along California's central coast are utilizing to increase, and improve upon, sustainability practices. Sample excellent wines, and learn the dynamic, forward-thinking process behind their creation.

programme.title: Blowing Up Right Now
programme.desc: A millennial couple in a dysfunctional long-term relationship break up amid a nuclear missile crisis in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Love Possibly
programme.desc: Love possibly follows Alex, a hopelessly romantic, rom-com obsessed virgin on a quest to find love. Alex quickly finds himself out of his depth when Lana, a Moldovan mail-order bride makes the bold decision to move to London to marry him.

programme.title: Monsoon Tide
programme.desc: After a devastating tsunami, Anni returns to India for the first time since her mother's mysterious suicide. While staying with her estranged stepfather, she uncovers clues as to who her mother was, and discovers the shocking cause of her death.

programme.title: Frank and Ava
programme.desc: A down and out Frank Sinatra, trying to hold on to his voice and salvage his career falls hard and fast for the sultry starlet, Ava Gardner, in this tumultuous heart-stirring Hollywood romance.

programme.title: Melrose
programme.desc: A struggling actor on the outskirts of Los Angeles, takes a sketchy day job on Melrose Avenue, and uncovers the dark reality of living Hollywood in the twenty-first century.

programme.title: 4 Minute Mile
programme.desc: A reclusive track coach meets a poverty-stricken teen, who is at a violent juncture in his life, and eventually shapes the boy into a world-class runner.

programme.title: Hold Fast, Good Luck
programme.desc: Two 20-somethings enter into an intense but transient relationship.

programme.title: What if it Works?
programme.desc: Adrian, an irrepressibly chirpy tech nerd, has OCD. Grace, a beautiful street artist, has Multiple Personality Disorder. It's a love story that seems impossible. But what if it works?

programme.title: Hit By Lightning
programme.desc: The loneliest man in North America finally meets the perfect woman but theres only one catch - she's married and wants him to kill her husband.

programme.title: Any Day
programme.desc: ex fighter (Sean Bean) is released from prison and falls for a girl (eva Longoria) while staying with his sister (Kate Walsh) all is fine until he starts drinking and his past catches up with him.

programme.title: Friends Effing Friends Effing Friends
programme.desc: A post-modern romantic comedy about sex amongst friends, missed opportunities, unrequited love and how the grass always appears to be greener on the other side...

programme.title: Wake.
programme.desc: A widowed mortician receives a birthday gag gift from her mother and daughter. The gift, a life-size doll, soon comes to life as her dead husband complicating life with her family and her budding relationship with a documentary filmmaker.

programme.title: Florrie
programme.desc: Florrie is dating three men, and juggling these men is catching up with her. Her best friend, Henrietta, tells her to pick pick just one of the committed boyfriends, but Florrie can't seem to accept love from any of them.

programme.title: Preggoland
programme.desc: When Ruth ruins a baby shower with her juvenile antics, her group promptly de-friends her. But when she is later mistaken to be 'with child' she is welcomed back into the group.

programme.title: Daffodils
programme.desc: Leaving her dying father to perform a gig, Maisie explores her parents' heartfelt love and how it all devastatingly fell apart. Told through Maisie's eyes, the love story is expressed with re-imaginings of iconic New Zealand hits.

programme.title: The Competition
programme.desc: A woman inspires millions with her 'PIG Theory' blog promoting a formula that keeps you safe from cheating.

programme.title: The Feels
programme.desc: Andi (Constance Wu) and Lu (Angela Trimbur) are excited to celebrate their upcoming wedding with a joint bachelorette weekend in wine country. On the first night, things goes awry when one of the brides admits she's never had an orgasm.

programme.title: 1 Million Happy Nows
programme.desc: The story of Lainey and eva's changing relationship as they struggle to deal with the diagnosis of Lainey's early Onset Alzheimer's.

programme.title: Forev
programme.desc: On a last-minute road trip, disenchanted Sophie and her naive neighbor Pete take a joke about marriage to the next level. Before long, they're engaged and stranded in the desert with Pete's sorority-girl sister, who is fresh off a break-up.

programme.title: CombiNATION Plates
